intro: Bequaertiodendron congolense, commonly known as the Congo bequaertiodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
